column4: can someone help me get an internet connection on ubuntu 7.10?
can someone help me get an internet connection on ubuntu 7.10?
your ethernet does not work? is this gutsy? can you access the computer now?
i can access it but i have to disconnect from irc to do so because i only have on cable.
this is computer you are using now? with another os?
it's another computer, mine. i just got it in the other day. it's a thinkpad t41
can you turn it on an type lspci in the terminal on it and tell (not paste in the channel) what the ethernet card is for that thinkpad--no need to connect at this point
F-u-z-z-Y: Ethernet controller: Intel Corp 82540EP Gigabit Ethernet Controller (Mobile) (rev 03)
so when you connect it to via ethernet you get no dhcp offers? this via network-manager or the terminal?
are you going to get this computer going on the same network? if so, via router or second ethernet cable? at some point in time that is
i'm going to unplug the ethernet cable plugged in this one, put it in the other computer's port and reset the cable modem
so both will be on the same network--or just the one computer?
one computer, one connection. one at a time
you have a livecd around? you might want to try booting from the livecd and see if that can acquire an internet connection--hard to know what you have done to your system
i'm sure it can get the internet... i'm going to reboot... brb
